column4: Network tools doesn't have a button or something for activating wlan0

doing "sudo ifconfig wlan0 up" just returns an error. I should mention that this problem happens to me all the time - if I disable wirless, and then disconnect from wired network before enabling it again, it won't work until I plug in to a wired network and restart.
Seems kind of a stupid problem but this has been the case between at least two releases..
check what driver are you using for your wireless, i have to switch it to make it works ok in my netbook
